results.title: The Noise was deafening
results.creator_credit: Peter Rawson, David Evans and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: This film is a safety education film and is designed to make both management and employees aware of the irreversible effects of excessive noise, to show how noise surveys should be carried out, and to highlight some of the methods by which excessive noise can be reduced.

results.title: East meets West
results.brief_description: West is a theatre company made up of actors, musicians and directors. In this program, the members of the company are working together with a Melbourne Vietnamese community and have devised a play which is intended as a welcome to Vietnamese immigrants in Australia. Scenes from rehearsals and excerpts from the performances are included.

results.title: Antarctic man. No. 1. Fears do not kill you
results.creator_credit: David Parer, ABC-TV (Australia), ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and Australia. Antarctic Division
results.brief_description: This is a two-part documentary about an international group of scientists who organised an expedition to the Antarctic. For three months they measured the stresses of Antarctic life on body and mind. Part 1 deals with the laboratory phase of the expedition as the scientists subject themselves to some gruelling experiments to discover the limits of their endurance. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Aids
results.creator_credit: George Pugh and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A 4-Corners presentation examining the history of the AIDS epidemic in the United States and the spread to gay communities in the Western World including Australia. Medical authorities discuss their hopes to contain the spread of AIDS outlining symptoms and debunking myths regarding transmission of the virus. A series of frank interviews highlight the human cost of AIDS. Due to copyright restrictions, certain parts of the music soundtrack have been edited resulting in sound drop-out in sections of the program.

results.title: Friend or foe
results.creator_credit: John Krish, Gordon L.T. Scott and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A children’s feature set in Britain during World War 2 that focuses on the experiences of two London boys sent to board with a farming family during the period of heavy bombing. On one particular day the pilot from a ditched German bomber saves one boy from drowning and the boys must then decide whether or not to tell the English authorities of the German’s whereabouts. This film is useful for discussion about the sense of war, concepts of right and wrong, the nature of friendship and loyalty, peer group pressure and family relationships. Based on the novel by Michael Morpugo, script by John Krish.

results.title: Turning 18
results.creator_credit: Tony Wright, Penny Robins, Peter Kaufman, Open Channel Productions and Video Projects
results.brief_description: An amusing look at some serious issues that are related to turning eighteen - the age by which a person is legally recognised as an adult in this society. This program, subtitled, “Almost 20 Minutes” is a parody of the current affairs television program, “60 Minutes”.

results.title: The Floor is yours (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Need, Management Training Ltd and Richard Need Productions
results.brief_description: A case study which tells the story of a young manager about to give his first business presentation and how he is saved from panic by help from an unexpected source. He discovers that good preparation is more than half the battle in successful communication and learns a tried and tested method that will see him through every kind of public speaking occasion.
